postBySlug.html:
Form submit to the list box

In the following code snippet, the value that is in selected state will be sent on form submit.

<form>
    <EjsListBox DataSource="@data"></EjsListBox>
    <EjsButton IsPrimary="true" Content="SUBMIT"></EjsButton>
</form>

@code {
    List<object> data = new List<object>
{
        new { text = "Hennessey Venom", id = "list-01" },
        new { text = "Bugatti Chiron", id = "list-02" },
        new { text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", id = "list-03" },
        new { text = "SSC Ultimate Aero", id = "list-04" },
        new { text = "Koenigsegg CCR", id = "list-05" },
        new { text = "McLaren F1", id = "list-06" },
        new { text = "Aston Martin One- 77", id = "list-07" },
        new { text = "Jaguar XJ220", id = "list-08" },
        new { text = "McLaren P1", id = "list-09" }
    };
}
postBySlug.excerpt: Form submit to the list box In the following code snippet, the value that is in selected state will be sent on form submit.

previous.html:
Select items to the list box

In the following example, Bugatti Chiron is selected using selectItems method.

<EjsListBox DataSource="@data" Created="@created" @ref="listboxobj"></EjsListBox>

@code {
    EjsListBox listboxobj;
    List<object> data = new List<object>
        {
        new { text = "Hennessey Venom", id = "list-01" },
        new { text = "Bugatti Chiron", id = "list-02" },
        new { text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", id = "list-03" },
        new { text = "SSC Ultimate Aero", id = "list-04" },
        new { text = "Koenigsegg CCR", id = "list-05" },
        new { text = "McLaren F1", id = "list-06" },
        new { text = "Aston Martin One- 77", id = "list-07" },
        new { text = "Jaguar XJ220", id = "list-08" }
        };

    public string[] Value = new string[] { "Bugatti Chiron" };
    public void created(object args)
    {
        listboxobj.SelectItems(this.Value, true);
    }
}

fields.seoContent: Select Items in Blazor [Preview] List Box | How To | Syncfusion Documentation

next.html:
Enable scroller

The ListBox supports scrolling and it can be achieved by restricting the height of the list box using height property.

In the following sample, height of the list box is restricted to 290px.

<EjsListBox DataSource="@data" Height="290px"></EjsListBox>

@code {
     List<object> data = new List<object>
     {
        new { text = "Hennessey Venom", id = "list-01" },
        new { text = "Bugatti Chiron", id = "list-02" },
        new { text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", id = "list-03" },
        new { text = "SSC Ultimate Aero", id = "list-04" },
        new { text = "Koenigsegg CCR", id = "list-05" },
        new { text = "McLaren F1", id = "list-06" },
        new { text = "Aston Martin One- 77", id = "list-07" },
        new { text = "Jaguar XJ220", id = "list-08" },
        new { text = "McLaren P1", id = "list-09" },
        new { text = "Ferrari LaFerrari", id = "list-10" }
     };
}

Output will be shown as
